course_name: Introduction to Computer Technology and Music
course_description: Introduces Finale, music engraving and playback software, and introduces sequencing and other software applications that may impact students while they are in school and as professional musicians.
prerequisites: None Listed

course_description: Introduction to music notation and to rhythmic, melodic, harmonic, and structural elements of music.  Emphasis on written skills, but ear training, sight singing, and keyboard components included as well.   Graded on A/F basis only.
prerequisites: consent required.  Placement by exam

course_name: Syntax, Structure and Style of Music I
course_description: Review of fundamentals. Study of rhythm, melody, harmonic, structure and stylistic characteristics of various periods. Application through original composition projects.
prerequisites: none for Music majors; others: instructor's consent.

course_name: Syntax, Structure and Style of Music II
course_description: Continuation of MUS_THRY 1220. Study of smaller forms and introduction to chromatic harmony.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 1220

course_name: Aural Training and Sight Singing I
course_description: Development of aural and sight singing skills.

course_name: Aural Training and Sight Singing II
course_description: Continuation of MUS_THRY 1230.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 1230

course_description: Fundamentals of composition and writing in small forms.
prerequisites: grade of B- or better in  MUS_THRY 1220, MUS_THRY 1221, MUS_THRY 1230, MUS_THRY 1231, and instructor's consent

course_description: Continuation of MUS_THRY 2215.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2215

course_name: Syntax, Structure and Style of Music III
course_description: Chromatic harmony, variation techniques and contrapuntal genres. Study of traditional forms in instrumental, vocal and choral compositions. Applications through original composition projects.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 1221

course_name: Syntax, Structure and Style of Music IV
course_description: Continued study of chromatic harmony and compositions in larger forms. Application through original composition projects.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2220

course_name: Aural Training and Sight Singing III
course_description: Continuation of MUS_THRY 1231. Further development of aural and sight singing skills with an emphasis on chromatic harmony and decorative pitches. Introduction of structural perception.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 1231 and MUS_THRY 2220 or MUS_THRY 2220 concurrently

course_name: Aural Training and Sight Singing IV
course_description: Continuation MUS_THRY 2230.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2230

course_description: Further development of creative writing in traditional forms.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2216

course_description: Continuation of MUS_THRY 3215.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 3215

course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 7210). Study of basic melodic and harmonic materials commonly used in jazz.  Application through arranging projects for small jazz groups.
prerequisites: MUSIC_NM 1211 or MUS_THRY 1220; instructor's consent required

course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 7211). Continuation of MUS_THRY 4210.  Study of advanced melodic and harmonic materials commonly used in jazz.  Application through arranging projects for small and large jazz groups.
prerequisites: MUS_THRY 4210; instructor's consent

course_description: Comprehensive study of the grammar and syntax of jazz harmony.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUSIC_NM 1211 or MUS_THRY 1220

course_description: Continuation of MUS_THRY 4212.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 4212

course_description: Writing of works in larger forms for a solo instrument or chamber ensemble.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 3216

course_description: Continuation of MUS_THRY 4215. May be repeated for additional credit.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 4215

course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 7220). The study and application of analytical procedures to 20th century music literature. Special readings; individual projects.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221

course_description: An analytical study of rhythmic, melodic, harmonic and structural aspects of 18th-, 19th- and 20th-century music.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221 or equivalent

course_description: The introduction of music software for educational and professional use. Music notation software will be learned. Sequencing software will be studied in depth. Hands-on experience with Macintosh computers, multi-timbral synthesizers and various CD-ROMS.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 4220

course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 7223). Study of contrapuntal procedures and representative works of the eighteenth century. Emphasis on compositions and style of Johann Sebastian Bach. Original composition projects: canon, invention, and fugue.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221

course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 7225). Analysis of contrapuntal procedures and representative compositions of 16th century. Emphasis on styles of Palestrina, Lassus and Victoria. Stylistic writing in two, three or more voices.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221

course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 7227). Study of orchestral instruments and the process of scoring for various orchestral combinations.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221

course_description: Transcription, scoring of solo and ensemble literature for band instrument combinations of varying sizes up to and including concert band.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221

course_description: Transcription and arrangement of music suitable for performance by various vocal ensembles.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221

course_description: Techniques of musical analysis developed by Heinrich Schenker.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221

course_description: Introduction to rhythmic analysis, including context of current thinking, basic concepts, various approaches, selected topics, performance issues, and particular problems.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221

course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 7233). The study of tuning systems and the properties, production and reception of musical sound.
prerequisites: instructor's consent

course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 7241). Continuation of MUS_THRY 4231, with a focus on the analysis of complete works, including larger forms.
prerequisites: Grade of C-minus or better in MUS_THRY 4231, or equivalent at another institution

course_description: Techniques used in the creation of music with tape recorders, voltage-controlled synthesizers and electronics.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 4220

course_description: Introduction to the techniques of digital synthesis, including the study of programming, and Musical Instrument Digital Interfacing.
prerequisites: instructor's consent

course_description: Analytical study of specific rhythmic, melodic, harmonic, and structural factors which constitute the stylistic practices of a specific period or MUS_THRY 4221 or equivalent. May be repeated for credit with departmental consent.
prerequisites: None Listed

course_description: Study of idiomatic chord progressions and harmonization strategies at the keyboard, including figured bass, score reading, and score playing.  Skills are reinforce by analysis, both at sight and prepared.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221; instructor's consent

course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 7267). Transcription for full orchestra of large works from different style periods.  Scoring of original works for orchestra. Seminar, private lessons.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 4227

course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 7268). Survey of original works for orchestra.
prerequisites: None Listed

course_description: Techniques and materials for teaching basic music theory courses for high schools and colleges.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221

course_description: Techniques and materials for advanced college courses in music theory.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in  MUS_THRY 4271

course_description: Study and application of various analytical systems for 20th century compositions. Analysis of music employing contemporary theories.
prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2221

course_description: Review of music theory for graduate students in music.  Does not fulfill graduate degree requirements. Graded on S/U basis only.
prerequisites: instructor's consent

course_name: Advanced Jazz Harmony and Arranging I
course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 4210). Study of basic melodic and harmonic materials commonly used in jazz.  Application through arranging projects for small jazz groups.
prerequisites: instructor's consent

course_name: Advanced Jazz Harmony and Arranging II
course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 4211). Continuation of MUS_THRY 7210.  Study of advanced melodic and harmonic materials commonly used in jazz.  Application through arranging projects for small and large groups.
prerequisites: instructor's consent

course_description: Fundamentals of Composition: Writing in small forms. For non-composition graduate students in music.
prerequisites: instructor's consent

course_description: Continuation of MUS_THRY 7215.
prerequisites: MUS_THRY 7215

course_description: (cross-leveled with MUS_THRY 4220). Graduate review in the study and application of analytical procedures to 20th century music literature. Special readings; individual projects.

course_description: Graduate review in the analytical study of rhythmic, melodic, harmonic and structural aspects of 18th-, 19th- and 20th-century music.

prerequisites: instructor's consent

prerequisites: Grade of C-minus or better in MUS_THRY 4231 or MUS_THRY 7231, or equivalent at another institution

prerequisites: instructor's consent

course_description: Advanced analytical study of specific rhythmic, melodic, harmonic, and structural factors which constitute the stylistic practices of a specific period or composer. May be repeated for credit with departmental consent.
prerequisites: instructor's consent
